questions.text: A 58-year-old woman with metastatic breast cancer develops exertional dyspnea and is found to have a large pericardial effusion, jugular venous distension, and hypotension. Which of the following signs is likely present?

options.label: A
options.text: Collapse of the right ventricle throughout systole on echocardiography

options.label: B
options.text: Collapse of the right ventricle during diastole on echocardiography

options.label: D
options.text: Rise of blood pressure during inspiration

questions.correct_answer: B. Collapse of the right ventricle during diastole on echocardiography

questions.text: Patient comes palpitation to ER. P-180/min, BP – 70mm of Hg systolic. ECG shows narrow qrs complex tachycardia with regular heart rate. What is the next step in management?
Which of the following is not included in CHADS2Vasc score to assess the risk of thromboembolism in atrial fibrillation?
Cardioversion is indicated in following arrythmia when the patient develops hypotension EXCEPT
In a patient with a wide-complex tachycardia, which ONE of the following ECG findings is not a marker of ventricular tachycardia?
What is the area marked ‘X’

A 60 yrs. old male with lung cancer complains of right sided chest pain, tingling and weakness of intrinsic muscles of his right hand as well as ipsilateral ptosis. Which one of the following complications of lung cancer is most likely cause?
Which of the following drug is known to decrease mortality in critically ill COVID patient?
Match column A & B and select answer using the code given below
Identify the following oxygen delivery device

True regarding pleural effusion is/are : A. Normal chest wall expansion on diseased side B. Stony dullness on percussion C. Coarse Crepitations heard on auscultation D. Air bronchogram is not the classical radiological finding. Select the right combination

options.label: A
options.text: If A, B, C are correct

options.label: B
options.text: If A and C are correct

options.label: C
options.text: If B and D are correct

options.label: D
options.text: If all four (A, B, C, & D) are correct

questions.correct_answer: C. If B and D are correct

questions.text: Match the Following Type
A 30-years-old lady presents with features of malabsorption and iron deficiency anaemia. Duodenal biopsy shows complete villus atrophy. Which of the following antibodies is likely to be present?
Stool osmotic gap is calculated as

options.label: A
options.text: Serum osmolarity – (2 X [fecal sodium + potassium concentration])

options.label: B
options.text: Stool osmolarity – (2 X [fecal sodium + potassium concentration])

options.label: C
options.text: Serum osmolarity – (2 X [serum sodium + potassium concentration])

questions.correct_answer: A. Serum osmolarity – (2 X [fecal sodium + potassium concentration])

questions.text: Stool osmotic gap increases and become > 50 mosm/L in all of the following except
Empty sella syndrome is often characterized by
True regarding pseudohypoparathyroidism include all except:

options.label: A
options.text: It is due to end organ insensitivity

options.label: B
options.text: Associated with low levels of calcium and high phosphate.

options.label: C
options.text: Albright dystrophy is associated with pseudohypoparathyroidism.

questions.correct_answer: D. Reduces serum level of PTH.

questions.text: A 21 yr patient presents with complaint of primary amenorrhoea. Her height is 153cm, weight is 51 kg. She has well developed breast. She has no pubic hair or axillary hair and hirsuitism. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following approved GLP-1 is an oral agent/s
Brown tumour of the bone is characteristic of:
Babesiosis is most commonly seen in
Which of the following causes of CKD doesn’t have enlarged kidneys?
Differentiating feature of Bartter syndrome versus Gitelman’s is :

A 45 years old Male presented with cough with haemoptysis. He also complains of low grade fever since last 10 days. On examination there is a purpuric skin rash over the lower limbs. On investigation Urine revealed presence of dysmorphic RBC and RBC cast. Serum Creatinine is 3.2. What is the diagnosis?

A 25 years old male comes with cough associated with sore throat and fever since 3 days. He also noticed passing blood in the urine. However his Serum creatinine is normal and Serum complement levels are normal. What is the diagnosis?

Following an extended course of antibiotics for documented pneumococcal meningitis, a 14-month old child is noted to have evidence of a developing hearing impairment. Which of the following would be the most appropriate testing modality to evaluate the hearing status for this child?

An 18-month-old boy presents for a follow-up visit 2 weeks after discharge from the hospital following treatment for Kawasaki disease with intravenous immunoglobulin (IG) and aspirin. He continues to take aspirin daily and is scheduled for an echocardiogram in several weeks to evaluate for coronary artery aneurysm. He is currently not up to date on his immunizations and is due for several vaccinations. Which of the following vaccines should be withheld at this time?

options.label: D
options.text: Haemophilus influenzae Type b conjugate vaccine (Hib)

questions.text: A 14-year-old female with cystic fibrosis presents with poor growth and complaint of increased bruising. She admits that she has been using her replacement pancreatic enzymes inconsistently. The patient is most likely deficient in which vitamins?
questions.correct_answer: C. A, D, E, and K

questions.text: A 2-week old infant presents to your office for the first well visit. The pregnancy and delivery were uneventful, and the infant appears well on physical examination. The family maintains a strict vegetarian diet, and the mother is currently breastfeeding. Which of the following do you prescribe as a supplement for the infant at this time?

During a well-child examination, an 8-month-old girl is found to have no change in her weight since her 6-month-old visit. She has fallen from the 25 to the 3 percentile in weight. She was breastfed until 6 months of age and now takes a soy-protein formula in addition to rice cereal, fruits, and vegetables. On physical examination, she is noted to have a sharply demarcated and intensely erythematous rash in the perineal and genital area, characterized by vesiculobullous and pustular lesions, some of which have dried to form scaly, eczematoid lesions. A sweat test is performed, which reveals a sweat chloride level of 75 mEq/L. What is the most likely cause of this patient’s rash?

options.label: A
options.text: Contact dermatitis due to bile salt malabsorption

options.label: C
options.text: Contact dermatitis due to fatty acidic stools

questions.text: A 12-year-old girl with newly diagnosed systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) presents for follow-up. She has been doing fairly well over the last 3 months. Which of the following is associated with a worse prognosis?

An 8-year-old girl presents with painful swelling along the length of the left index finger, which is accentuated around the distal interphalangeal joint; range of motion is limited on physical examination. Nail pitting and onycholysis are also noted. A radiograph demonstrates soft tissue swelling and periosteal new bone formation of the left index finger. History of known trauma is denied. An antinuclear antibody (ANA) test is strongly positive. Which of the following is most likely to complicate this patient’s clinical course?

A 15-year-old girl with a history of fever, anorexia, myalgias, and fatigue of 3-weeks duration is noted to have scaly erythematous, slightly raised lesions on the dorsal surface of the knuckles. This finding is most consistent with which of the following?

A 6-year-old male is brought to the emergency department because of abdominal pain, diarrhea, bilateral knee pain with swelling, and purpuric rash on his legs. These symptoms started approximately 2 weeks after an upper respiratory infection. Workup reveals leukocytosis and elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate. The serum chemistry panel and urinalysis are normal. What is the best next step in managing this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Treat with hydration and pain medications.

questions.correct_answer: C. Treat with hydration and pain medications.

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy with a 2-day history of rash presents with the sudden onset of abdominal pain. The rash consists of ecchymosis, petechiae, and, in a few areas, palpable purpura. It is located over the lower extremities and dorsal and plantar surfaces of the feet and buttocks. The abdominal exam reveals diminished bowel sounds, diffuse tenderness on percussion, and a palpable sausage-shaped fullness in the right lower quadrant. A rectal exam reveals currant jelly stool that is guaiac-positive. Which of the following is the most likely complication associated with this patient’s abdominal pain?

A 45-year-old man comes to the OPD with groin pain and swelling. About a month ago, he noticed a sore on his penis but did not seek medical attention because the ulcer was not painful and disappeared within a week. Several days ago, he began to experience painful swelling in his inguinal region, with inflammation of the overlying skin and eventual formation of several draining ulcers. He also has mild fever and malaise that began around the same time as his groin symptoms. The patient is a sailor. His other medical problems include well-controlled hypertension and hyperlipidaemia. Cell scrapings from his lesions show cytoplasmic inclusion bodies as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

A 26-year-oId man comes to the clinic due to a 3-day-history of dysuria and urethral discharge. The symptoms developed about 2 weeks after he had unprotected sexual intercourse with a new partner. On physical examination, a mucoid discharge is expressed with gentle milking of the penis. Gram stain of the discharge reveals numerous neutrophils with intracellular diplococci. A sample of the discharge is placed on an antibiotic-containing medium, and bacterial colonies are cultured. Which of the following terms best describes the medium?

A previously healthy 2-year-old boy is brought to the clinic with fever and mouth pain that began yesterday. He has consumed an adequate amount of fluids but refuses to eat due to the pain. The patient has no medical problems and takes no medications. Physical examination reveals swollen gums and vesicular inflamed lesions on his hard palate and lips as shown in the image . He has enlarged and tender cervical lymph nodes. Which of the following is most likely responsible for this patient's condition?

A 35-year-old man comes to the clinic due to 3 months of progressive swelling under his left jaw. The swelling spontaneously opened and drained pus a month ago but has not improved or resolved. The patient has no medical conditions other than dental caries; he had a tooth extracted prior to symptom onset. Physical examination shows an indurated, nontender mass in the left submandibular area with a small opening on the overlying skin. Gentle pressure on the mass yields thick pus containing sand/grain-like particles. The microbial pathogen with which of the following characteristics is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

An 86-year-old woman is hospitalized for a urinary tract infection due to Escherichia coir and is being treated with ceftriaxone. She has a history of advanced dementia., coronary artery disease, and congestive heart failure. On the fifth day of hospitalization, she seems agitated. The nurse also reports that the patient had 3 episodes of diarrhea the previous night. Her temperature is 38.30 C. In addition to appropriate hand hygiene, which of the following equipment is necessary before examining this patient?

Microbiology researchers conduct a series of experiments to determine how pathogenicity is transmitted among different strains of Streptococcus pneumoniae. In the first experiment, they inject nonvirulent strain A into the peritoneal cavity of laboratory mice and observe no ill effects. In the second experiment, researchers subject virulent strain B to a detergent agent that kills and lyses the bacterial cells. They then inject the lysate into the peritoneal cavity of a new group of mice and again observe no ill effects. During a third experiment they inject live strain A bacteria in combination with the killed strain B lysate; resulting in death of the mice. Which of the following genetic processes most likely accounts for the observed findings of these experiments?
questions.correct_answer: A. Direct uptake of extracellular DNA

questions.text: A 40-year-old farmer from Ohio seeks evaluation at a clinic with complaints of achronic cough, fevers, and anorexia of several months duration. On examination, he has generalized lymphadenopathy with hepatosplenomegaly. A chest radiograph reveals local infiltrates and patchy opacities involving all lung fields. Fine needle aspiration of an enlarged lymph node shows the presence of intracellular yeast. Microscopy from fungal culture shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old woman in suffers from a macrocytic anemia. Her history is significant for frequent consumption of pickled fish. A stool sample reveals parasite ova like the one shown in the image. Upon treatment, she expels a tapeworm in stool. With which tapeworm was she most likely infected?

A 20 year old female patient who appears somewhat anxious, acknowledges an infestation of bugs on her pubic area. As evidence, she produces a bug as shown in the image. What relevant advice should be offered to this patient when considered the overarching ramifications of the case?

options.label: A
options.text: Avoid hot tub use, especially facilities with inadequate chlorination

options.label: B
options.text: Submit to a thorough screening for common sexually transmitted infections

options.label: C
options.text: Treat pet dog or cat with shampoo containing insecticide

options.label: D
options.text: Wash all clothing that has been stored for more than 2 months

questions.correct_answer: B. Submit to a thorough screening for common sexually transmitted infections

questions.text: Which cytokine is essential for T-cell proliferation and is also necessary for the production of CD25-positive regulatory T cells?
What is the treatment of stage 4 sleep disorders or parasomnias?
REM sleep behavioural disorder is mostly seen in association with? (NIMHANS 19)

The parents of a 10-year-old child report that the child is still wetting the bed. The child is very upset about this because he would like to go away to summer camp but is afraid that he will wet the bed there as well. Physical examination is unremarkable and the child is otherwise developing typically for his age. Behavioral interventions such as limiting fluids before bed and the bell and pad apparatus have not been effective. At this time, which of the following is the best choice for pharmacologic management of enuresis in this child

A childhood friend makes a visit to your office. The last time you saw her was at her wedding one year ago. As the conversation proceeds, you ask her casually if married life is treating her well. She suddenly bursts into tears and admits that her husband is physically abusive, but that she can't leave him because she is deeply afraid of being alone. Going back to childhood, this woman has always had her parents make decisions for her, including those regarding her education and career. She has always been very pleasant and courteous in her dealings with others, and avoids arguments or disagreements whenever possible. Which of the following personality disorders does this woman most likely suffer from?

A young girl with anorexia nervosa is on treatment. Even after taking adequate food according to the recommended diet plan for last 1 week, there is no gain of weight. What is the next step in management? (AIIMS NOV 19)

options.label: B
options.text: Observe the patient for 2 hours after giving meal

options.label: D
options.text: Increase the caloric intake from 1500 kcal to 2000 kcal per day

questions.correct_answer: B. Observe the patient for 2 hours after giving meal

questions.text: From what distance can a 6/6 patient can see the 6/24 letter on Snellen chart:
True about pigmentary glaucoma:

options.label: C
options.text: Slit-like transillumination defects in the mid periphery

options.label: D
options.text: Occur due to increased production of aqueous

questions.correct_answer: C. Slit-like transillumination defects in the mid periphery

questions.text: Which extraocular muscle causes pure depression in adduction?
The following is sign is seen in which retinal layer?
Identify the fluoroscein angiography image given for a diabetic female

A 50 year old patient has been wearing – 2 D glasses for both eyes. He noticed blurring of vision in his right eye recently and went to the doctor. To his surprise, the doctor told that his power of right eye has increased to -5 D while left eye was still the same. Vision in both eyes was 6/6 with full correction. What could be the possibility?
If caloric testing is done in this patient, what can be true for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Cold water was instilled in left ear

options.label: B
options.text: Cold water was instilled in right ear

options.label: C
options.text: Cold water was instilled in left eye

options.label: D
options.text: Warm water was instilled in left ear

questions.correct_answer: A. Cold water was instilled in left ear

questions.text: A 64-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to sudden painless loss of vision in the right eye. He has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus. He has had no trauma but gave history of similar episode in the past. Cardiovascular examination reveals irregularly irregular rhythm with no murmurs. Visual acuity in the right eye is hand motion only and normal in the left eye. Fundoscopic examination revealed edema of the macular leaving the foveal area. The pathology can be most likely attributed to?
Bitemporal superior quadrantanopia is seen in lesion of?
The given chart checks which sense?
Which of the following is a true statement :

options.label: B
options.text: Scratches with oozing of blood is classified under Cat 2 exposure

options.label: C
options.text: Yersinia pestis is category A bioterrorism agent

options.label: D
options.text: Vector of scrub typhus : Soft tick

questions.correct_answer: C. Yersinia pestis is category A bioterrorism agent

questions.text: Indicator used to identify high risk age groups for mortality :
A pregnant was diagnose to be HIV positive in second trimester. What's next line of management:

options.label: B
options.text: Start ART as soon as diagnosed

options.label: C
options.text: Start ART if CD4 count is less than 500

options.label: D
options.text: Start Nevirapine and continue for lifelong

questions.correct_answer: B. Start ART as soon as diagnosed

questions.text: Which of the false regarding AFP Surveillance :

options.label: A
options.text: Non-polio AFP rate is an indicator for operational efficiency

options.label: B
options.text: Samples should reach laboratory within 72 hrs from the point of collection

options.label: D
options.text: Adequate stool sample collection from 100% of cases

questions.correct_answer: D. Adequate stool sample collection from 100% of cases

questions.text: A chest physician observed that the distribution of forced expiratory volume (FEV) in 200 smokers had a median value of 3 litres with the first and third quartiles being 1.5 and 4.5 litres respectively. Based on this data how many persons in the sample are expected to have FEV below 4.5 litres?
Which of the following is true statement as per the information given below in the table :

options.label: B
options.text: Odds ratio will be less than 1

options.label: C
options.text: Drug abuse is protective against stroke

options.label: D
options.text: Chi square test can be applied here to assess statistical significance of association

questions.correct_answer: D. Chi square test can be applied here to assess statistical significance of association

questions.text: The study included 1,000 who took the new drug for 5 years and 1,000 were given the standard therapy. At the end of the trial, 6% of the men in the standard therapy group experienced a stroke, compared to only 2% in the group taking the new drug. Which of the following is true :

options.label: A
options.text: 25 men had to receive the new drug for 5 years in order for one man to benefit (i.e. one less stroke to occur)

options.label: B
options.text: 20 men had to receive the new drug for 5 years in order for one man to benefit (i.e. one less stroke to occur)

questions.correct_answer: A. 25 men had to receive the new drug for 5 years in order for one man to benefit (i.e. one less stroke to occur)

questions.text: Which of the following are deficiencies screened under RBSK : 1. Severe acute malnutrition 2. Vitamin A deficiency 3. Vitamin D deficiency 4. Zinc deficiency

A prospective study is designed to assess the association between arsenic and the risk of cancer. Small studies conducted earlier suggest a possible association. This study intends to find the significant association. Which of the following is most important to not commit type 2 error ?

You are evaluating a journal article describing a test for the diagnosis of congestive heart failure (CHF). In the study described, 250 consecutive patients were given the test. Of the 250 subjects, 100 tested positive tor CHF and 150 tested negative. All 250 subjects were then evaluated by expert cardiologists who were blinded to the results at the experimental test. These cardiologists determined that out of persons who tested positive, 90 actually had CHF. Further, the cardiologists found that of the 150 who tested negative, 20 truly had CHF. What is the positive predictive value (PPV) of this test for the diagnosis of CHF?
Based on the given data , calculate IMR : • Population : 10000 • CBR : 20 per 1000 • Neonatal deaths : 10 • Post neonatal deaths : 2
Which of the following is not a target of reduction in Poshan Abhiyan :
Which of the following is not a target of “Global action plan for NCDs” :

options.label: A
options.text: A 25% relative reduction in the overall mortality from cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes, or chronic respiratory diseases

options.label: B
options.text: At least 10% relative reduction in the harmful use of alcohol

options.label: C
options.text: A 20% relative reduction in prevalence of insufficient physical activity

options.label: D
options.text: A 30% relative reduction in mean population intake of salt/sodium

questions.correct_answer: C. A 20% relative reduction in prevalence of insufficient physical activity

questions.text: Which of the following protocol is used to assess risk factors for NCDs :
Which of the following is true regarding this scheme :

options.label: C
options.text: Maternity benefits for 12 weeks for confinement.

questions.text: In a case of chest injury which of the following is not included in lethal six of deadly dozen?
Which of the following is a feature of Karnohan’s notch phenomenon?
A man presented with fractures of 4th to 10th ribs and respiratory distress after a Road Traffic Accident (RTA). He is diagnosed to have flail chest and a P a O 2 of <60 mm Hg, management is:
Most common site of subependymal giant cell astrocytoma
Which of the following is not a class I Ag (HLA)?
Which organ is least commonly involved in acute graft versus host disease?
A patient on TPN developed dry, scaly, pruritic rash on the trunk and extremities. This lesion is most likely caused by:

During a diaper change in a six week old child her mother noted a lesion in the umbilicus. The lesion was not noted during a previous office visit when the infant was 10 days old and still had the umbilical cord attached. On examination, there was a soft, red mass at the base of the umbilicus. Although the lesion was slightly moist, no foul discharge or purulent drainage was present. The surrounding skin was not red, warm, or swollen. Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following statements regarding unusual hernias is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: An obturator hernia may produce nerve compression diagnosed by a positive Howship-Romberg sign.

options.label: B
options.text: Grynfeltt's hernia appears through the superior lumbar triangle, whereas Petit's hernia occurs through the inferior lumbar triangle.

options.label: C
options.text: Sciatic hernias usually present with a painful groin mass below the inguinal ligament.

options.label: D
options.text: Littre's hernia is defined by a Meckel's diverticulum presenting as the sole component of the hernia sac.

questions.correct_answer: C. Sciatic hernias usually present with a painful groin mass below the inguinal ligament.

questions.text: Which alpha-blocker has the strongest association with floppy iris syndrome?
SURGERY In penile fracture when Tunica albuginea damaged but Bucks Fascia is intact. This suggests hematoma in?
Histologically Zellballen pattern is seen in?

options.label: A
options.text: Tumour of Zona granulosa of adrenal

options.label: B
options.text: Tumour of Zona fasciculata of adrenal

options.label: C
options.text: Tumour of Zona reticularis of adrenal

questions.correct_answer: A. Tumour of Zona granulosa of adrenal

questions.text: Which of the following is not an indication of DPL in abdominal trauma?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients who are in shock and FAST is not available

options.label: C
options.text: >10 ml blood aspirated in DPA (Diagnostic peritoneal aspiration)

options.label: D
options.text: CT scanning is not available with equivocal physical exam findings like lap-belt sign, injuries to adjacent structures such as the lower ribs.

questions.correct_answer: C. >10 ml blood aspirated in DPA (Diagnostic peritoneal aspiration)

questions.text: A 45 year old gentleman has undergone truncal vagotomy and pyloroplasty for bleeding duodenal ulcer seven years ago. Now he has intractable recurrent symptoms of peptic ulcer. All of the following suggest the diagnosis of Zollinger Ellison syndrome, except:

options.label: C
options.text: Ulcers in proximal jejunum and lower end of esophagus.

options.label: D
options.text: Serum gastrin value of 200 pg/mi with secretin stimulation.

questions.correct_answer: B. Serum gastrin value of 500 pg/mi.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about carcinoma colon

options.label: A
options.text: Lesion on the left side of the colon presents with features of anemia

options.label: B
options.text: Solitary metastasis is liver is not a contraindication for surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Mucinous carcinoma has a good prognosis

options.label: D
options.text: Duke's A stage should receive adjuvant chemotherapy

questions.correct_answer: B. Solitary metastasis is liver is not a contraindication for surgery

questions.text: A 50 year old male patient, an alcoholic and smoker presents with a 3 hour history of severe retrosternal chest pain and increasing shortness of breath. He started having this pain while eating following an episode of forceful vomiting, which was constant and radiated to the back and interscapular region. He was a known hypertensive. On examination, he was cold and clammy with a heart rate of 130/min, and a BP of 80/40 mmHg. JVP was normal. All peripheral pulses were present and equal. Breath sounds were decreased at the left lung base and chest x-ray showed left pleural effusion. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not an operation for Hirschsprung’s disease?
Which of the following disappears by itself by the age of 7-8 years?
Most common flap used after Radical neck dissection is?
Maximum strength is a wound is achieved at?
Tumors of anterior mediastinum include the following except
Commonest melanoma seen in elderly people on the face is?
The most common cause of hypercalcemic crisis is:
Kalloo 45 years presents with a swelling in the thyroid gland and a lymphnode in the neck. Aspiration of the node shows amyloid material. What is the management of choice for this patient
questions.correct_answer: B. Total thyroidectomy with neck dissection

questions.text: String of pearl appearance in renal angiography is seen in?
Match the following

A drug was tested in the electrophysiology laboratory to determine its effects on the cardiac action potential in normal ventricular cells. The results are shown in the diagram. Which of the following drugs does this agent most resemble?

In a study of new diuretics, an investigational drug was given daily for 8 d and urine output was analyzed. The following data were obtained. Which mechanism best explains the effects shown on the graph?

options.label: B
options.text: Blockade of a Na+ /K+ /2Cl– transporter in the ascending limb of the loop of Henle

options.label: C
options.text: Blockade of a NaCl transporter in the distal convoluted tubule

options.label: D
options.text: Block of aldosterone in the cortical collecting tubule

questions.correct_answer: C. Blockade of a NaCl transporter in the distal convoluted tubule

questions.text: Which of the following drugs often causes tachycardia and tremor when used in asthma?
Of the following drugs, which has established clinical uses that include attention deficit hyperkinetic disorder, enuresis, and the management of chronic pain?
A 24-year-old woman is to be treated with levofloxacin for a urinary tract infection. A contraindication to the use of the antibiotic in this patient is

A 55-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes was going to be started on metformin. Before initiating therapy, it is important to confirm that the patient has normal renal function because patients with unrecognized renal insufficiency who take normal doses of metformin are at increased risk of which of the following?
The drug in this patient’s regimen that inhibits posttranslational modification of viral proteins is

The selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors fluoxetine and paroxetine are potent inhibitors of hepatic CYP2D6 drugmetabolizing enzymes. This action may lead to changes in the intensity of the effects of
Mavacamten useful in
The location and name of receptor for absorption of vitamin B12 is?
Match the following Morphological changes with corresponding causes
The vacutainer used for measuring ESR is

A 28-year young healthy male is donating Single donor platelet for the first time. By the time the procedure is completed the donor develops tingling sensation in his lips. Which of the following could have occurred in him?

A 43-year-old man has complained of mild burning substernal pain following meals for the past 3 years. Upper GI endoscopy is performed and biopsies are taken of an erythematous area of the lower esophageal mucosa 3 cm above the gastroesophageal junction. There is no mass lesion, no ulceration, and no hemorrhage noted. The biopsies show the presence of columnar epithelium with goblet cells. Which of the following mucosal alterations is most likely represented by these findings?

A 1 year infant is having facial twitches seizures and recurrent sinopulmonary infections. He also had an episode of lung abscess and meningitis. Which of the following finding is expected in this child?
Which of the following transmission patterns is most consistent with this patient’s family history?

A young boy is being evaluated for developmental delay, mild autism, and mental retardation. Physical examination reveals the boy to have large, everted ears and a long face with a large mandible. He is also found to have macroorchidism (large testes), DNA analysis showed a trinucleotide disorder. Which one of the following is the correct regarding this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: His father would have same repeats as him

options.label: B
options.text: His maternal grandfather will have less repeats than him

options.label: C
options.text: One of his parent has to be affected

options.label: D
options.text: It is a autosomal dominant disease

questions.correct_answer: B. His maternal grandfather will have less repeats than him

questions.text: Which of the following is an intermediate grade vascular neoplasm?
Histological examination of lung from a 1-day old neonate who died is as shown in the image. What is the likely pathogenesis in this neonate causing such disease?
Biopsy from lung mass in a patient is as follows which of the following is most likely clinical presentation of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: A middle-aged woman who has never smoked

options.label: B
options.text: A male chronic smoker with hypercalcemia

options.label: C
options.text: A male smoker with lung mass and hemiparesis

options.label: D
options.text: A smoker male with renal mass and multiple lesions in lungs

questions.correct_answer: C. A male smoker with lung mass and hemiparesis

questions.text: Which of the salivary gland tumor occurs exclusively in parotid glands?
True about celiac disease are all except

options.label: A
options.text: Increased intraepithelial lymphocytes is earliest histological finding

options.label: B
options.text: Increased risk to develop B cell lymphomas

options.label: C
options.text: HLA DQ 2 have and increased association with celiac disease

options.label: D
options.text: Marsh grading is used for histological diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: B. Increased risk to develop B cell lymphomas

questions.text: Renal Biopsy from a patient shows proliferation of mesangial cells and thickened basement membrane on light microscopy. Immunofluroscence shows granular deposits of C3 only. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following interleukins is responsible for type I hypersensitivity?
In a patient with multiple bilateral nasal polyps with x-ray showing opacity in the para-nasal sinuses. The treatment consists of all of the following except:
Which of the following symptoms is typically seen in an infant with a type 2 glottic web?

options.label: C
options.text: Hoarse, weak cry, stridor with exertion

questions.correct_answer: C. Hoarse, weak cry, stridor with exertion

questions.text: Which of the following is applicable to Otosclerosis? A. Dip at 2000 Hz in Bone conduction curve B. Worsening of hearing loss during pregnancy C. Schwartz sign in early stage of disease D. Diplacusis E. Roll over phenomena

A patient with right side hearing loss has tuning fork findings as follows.. Rinne is negative on right side, positive on left side. Weber is lateralized towards left ear. What is the most probable diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Right side severe sensorineural hearing loss

options.label: D
options.text: These are normal tuning fork findings for right ear, hence there is no hearing loss in right ear

questions.correct_answer: C. Right side severe sensorineural hearing loss

questions.text: A 70 year old male presents with a 3 month history of right pulsatile tinnitus with hearing loss, unstable gait,and autophany.ECOG demonstrates a SP/AP ratio of 0.6. A diagnosis of superior semicircular canal dehiscence is suspected. Which of the following is a good indicator test that would give support to this diagnosis:
questions.correct_answer: C. Cervical vestibular evoked myogenic potential

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about physiology of nose

options.label: A
options.text: The inspiratory and expiratory air currents pass through middle part of nasal cavity

options.label: B
options.text: Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration

options.label: C
options.text: Nasal cilia beat 10-20 times per second and mucociliary clearance time is 10 -20 minutes.

options.label: D
options.text: Nasal cycle of rhythmic congestion and decongestion varies every 2.5 to 4 hours

questions.correct_answer: B. Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration

options.label: D

questions.text: A 56-year-old man presents with complaints of fatigue and headaches. During the physical examination, he is found to have a wide pulse pressure. Which of the following conditions causes the pulse pressure to increase?

A 75-year-old patient is to undergo an emergency laparotomy for subacute bowel obstruction. He suffers from chronic atrial fibrillation and is on warfarin. The patient’s INR is 2.0 on admission. What would be the best course of his management?

options.label: A
options.text: Wait for the INR to correct on its own.

options.label: B
options.text: Correct INR pre-operatively with vitamin K and prothrombin concentrate.

options.label: D
options.text: Correct INR pre-operatively with only vitamin K.

questions.correct_answer: B. Correct INR pre-operatively with vitamin K and prothrombin concentrate.

questions.text: Concerning train-of-four stimulation:

options.label: A
options.text: The TOF ratio compares the ratio of the strengths of the first to fourth twitch

options.label: B
options.text: Four twitches of 0.5 Hz each are applied over 2 seconds

options.label: C
options.text: On administration of non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent, fade occurs before the disappearance of the twitches

options.label: D
options.text: For surgery, at least three twitches must be absent to achieve adequate surgical condition

questions.correct_answer: C. On administration of non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent, fade occurs before the disappearance of the twitches

questions.text: Concerning inhalational anaesthetic potency:

options.label: A
options.text: There is inverse proportionality between oil: gas partition coefficients and potency

options.label: B
options.text: MAC is directly proportional to potency

options.label: C
options.text: Halothane is more potent than sevoflurane

options.label: D
options.text: Desflurane’s quick onset and offset reflects its low potency

questions.correct_answer: C. Halothane is more potent than sevoflurane

questions.text: Capnography is an essential component of patient monitoring during general anaesthesia. The following questions concern intralipid and its role in the treatment of local anaesthetic toxicity.

options.label: A
options.text: It should only be used in cardiac arrest situations

options.label: B
options.text: The initial loading dose when treating local anaesthetic toxicity is 15 ml.kg–1

options.label: C
options.text: Propofol can be used as a substitute where Intralipid is not available

options.label: D
options.text: CPR may have to continue for a long time after the administration of intralipid

questions.correct_answer: D. CPR may have to continue for a long time after the administration of intralipid

questions.text: The fracture shown in the picture is called as ?
Telephono is ?
CONSIDER THE STATEMENTS: STATEMENT A- Bhang, Ganja and Charas are products of poppy capsule. STATEMENT B- Their use is characterized by frenzied desire of committing murders.

options.label: A
options.text: Statement A & statement B are individually correct & statement B is the correct explaination of statement A.

options.label: B
options.text: Statement A & statement B are individually correct. But statement B is not the correct explaination of statement A.

options.label: C
options.text: Statement A is false but statement B is correct

options.label: D
options.text: Statement A is correct but statement B is incorrect

questions.correct_answer: C. Statement A is false but statement B is correct

questions.text: All of the following statements are TRUE , except :

options.label: A
options.text: Kyphoplasty incorporates injection of PMMA ( Polymethylene methacrylate ) into the collapsed vertebral body via balloon technique

options.label: B
options.text: Kyphoplasty is safe and superior to Vertebroplasty since there are less chances of extravasation of cement in the former technique

options.label: C
options.text: Cementing whether vertebroplasty or kyphoplasty can be done in tubercular disease process induced collapsed vertebral bodies

options.label: D
options.text: Cement induced vertebral height inflation corrects not only the posture but also helps in relieving the bone pains

questions.correct_answer: C. Cementing whether vertebroplasty or kyphoplasty can be done in tubercular disease process induced collapsed vertebral bodies

questions.text: Patient is brought to emergency after road traffic accident with multiple fractures of humerus. On examination he is unable to flex and supinate forearm. Also there is loss of sensations on lateral aspect of forearm. Which of the following Nerve is injured?

options.label: B
options.text: Persistence of a portion of vitello-intestinal duct
